DataElement.preferredDefinition: Terminology to describe the type of substance use as defined by the sponsor.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Substance Use Reported Name Clinical Study Sponsor Definition Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The literal identifier of the substance in use._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_A concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A battery-powered electronic device designed to atomize a nicotine-containing liquid solution for inhalation in a manner that simulates smoking a tobacco cigarette.

Concepts.definition: A battery-powered electronic device designed to atomize a nicotine-containing liquid solution for inhalation in a manner that simulates smoking a tobacco cigarette.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A compact roll of tobacco leaves prepared for smoking. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: A compact roll of tobacco leaves prepared for smoking.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.(NCI)

Concepts.definition: Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. Concepts.definition: The literal identifier of the substance in use.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
A concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
